title: Vatican Aims to Expedite Trial of U.S. Archbishop McCarrick
summary: Officials seek to process McCarrick case before Vatican summit in February on sex abuse. VATICAN CITY-The Vatican plans to try Archbishop Theodore McCarrick as early as this coming week , in order to make a final decision on his fate before next month's Vatican summit on sex abuse, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Clashes Break Out as France's 'Yellow-Vest' Protests Show Signs of Revival
summary: Flare-up of unrest suggests 'gilets jaunes' continue to present a challenge to President Emmanuel Macron. PARIS-Thousands of "yellow-vest" protesters took to France's streets Saturday, some clashing with riot police, in a renewed show of force against the government after demonstrations flagged during the holiday season.

title: E-commerce Expertise Comes to Health Startup Turnaround
summary: Blink Health hired executives involved in the launch of travel sites Orbitz and Kayak and more than doubled its number of engineers to 60. A health-care startup struggling to remake how patients fill drug prescriptions is trying to cure its ills by hiring tech-industry veterans for help.

title: When Some Broadway Curtains Close, the Show Goes On at Smaller Theaters
summary: 'The Play That Goes Wrong' will transfer off-Broadway in February.

title: Bolton Warns Syria Not to Use Chemical Weapons
summary: The national security adviser's remarks come after Trump announced the U.S. would withdraw its forces. JERUSALEM-The Trump administration still intends to take military action against Syria if President Bashar al-Assad's regime uses chemical weapons against civilians, White House national security adviser John Bolton said Saturday.

title: Serial Pickpockets to Blame for Bump in New York City Subway Crime, Police Say
summary: Crime on public transportation rose 3.8% in 2018; 'They're taking anything'. Serial pickpockets drove an uptick in crime in New York City's transit system in 2018, one of the few areas in the city where major felonies increased last year, according to police officials.

title: The Two NFL Teams Nobody Wants to Play Are Playing Each Other
summary: The Colts and the Texans both enter the playoffs on a roll, featuring dangerous quarterbacks who can be utterly unstoppable. The first time Deshaun Watson met Andrew Luck on a football field, the question wasn't so much who would win but who wouldn't lose. The Texans and Colts were mired in horrible funks to begin their seasons and the idea that either team would sniff the playoffs was growing fainter by the week.

title: Michael Che of 'SNL' Stands Up for NYCHA Residents
summary: 'Weekend Update' co-host taps comedy community for show to benefit public-housing authority. "Saturday Night Live" star Michael Che knows that New York City's deteriorating public-housing system is no laughing matter, but he hopes his jokes can help.

title: Put Down That Spoon-This Soup Is For Drinking
summary: As people seek alternatives to sweet beverages and try to consume more vegetables, food makers offer soup packaged for sipping-from chilled bottles to cups with lids. Do people want to drink their soup?

title: 'Goldbergs' Spinoff 'Schooled' Is In Session
summary: Following a pilot that took an unusual path, the new half-hour show is slated to premiere after its predecessor on ABC. ABC is taking a swing at the 1990s in the form of "Schooled," a spinoff of its '80s-themed hit television series "The Goldbergs."

title: Stock Selloff Could Hit Berkshire Hathaway
summary: The company and others could see the market's tumble hurt earnings because of accounting rules. Investors are feeling the sting of the stock market's slump, and soon companies such as Berkshire Hathaway Inc. and Facebook Inc. might, too.

title: Landlords Boosted Rents Last Year, but Tenants May Soon Have the Edge
summary: Developers are slated to complete in 2019 the most new units in about three decades. Landlords are expected to have a tough time raising rents this year as a crush of new apartments hits the market, ending a brief reprieve when the market picked up late last year.

title: Warren Jumps Into Primary Fray With Visit to Iowa
summary: As the first top-name candidate to visit the state, the senator is aiming to build enthusiasm for next year's caucuses. COUNCIL BLUFFS, Iowa-Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren joined the 2020 Democratic presidential primary brawl Friday night, becoming the first top-tier candidate to visit Iowa in the most wide-open contest in generations.

title: The Butterfly Effect That Powers a Masters Swimmer
summary: Tackling the toughest stroke for 9 miles a week lays a fitness foundation for a swimming lifer still kicking it in competitive races at 75. David Kirby has been swimming laps in the pool for more than half a century. At 75, he considers the resulting green-tinted hair and goggle marks around his eyes badges of honor.

title: Shooting in Los Angeles-Area Bowling Alley Leaves Three Dead
summary: Multiple victims were found shot inside the gaming venue. A late-night fight at a California bowling alley turned deadly Friday night, killing three men and injuring four.

title: Your Ice Cream Will Ride in a Self-Driving Car Before You Do
summary: Moving a few pounds of stuff to people turns out to be much easier than getting large, impatient and litigious human beings to their destinations. The first time you encounter a fully self-driving commercial vehicle, odds are it will be delivering your groceries rather than ferrying you to your destination.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Jeff Bezos and Jamie Dimon: Best of Frenemies
summary: The JPMorgan chief and Amazon founder have found their companies' fortunes increasingly entwined, but the balance of power between their firms has shifted. JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive James Dimon assembled a team in 2017 to answer a question that had been nagging at him for a while: "How should we think about Amazon?"

title: Trump Considers Declaring Emergency to Build Wall
summary: President speaks at lengthy news conference after contentious talks on government shutdown with Democratic lawmakers. WASHINGTON-President Trump said he was considering declaring a national emergency to build a southern border wall if Congress doesn't fund it, following a Friday meeting with congressional leaders that both Mr. Trump and Democratic lawmakers described as contentious.

title: A Top Executive at Nissan to Take Leave of Absence
summary: Muñoz, who previously oversaw U.S. strategy, was widely considered a potential successor to the CEO. TOKYO-One of Nissan Motor Co. 's top executives, José Muñoz, is taking a leave of absence, the company said Saturday, the first shake-up of top management in the wake of the arrest of former Chairman Carlos Ghosn.

title: Trump Signals Willingness to Negotiate on Skilled Foreign Workers
summary: President says he favors merit-based immigration, is open to discussions after resolving border-wall dispute. WASHINGTON-President Trump said Friday that he wants to find ways to allow companies to retain top foreign workers, as he made an argument for shifting toward a merit-based immigration system.

title: AbbVie to Record $4 Billion Impairment on Stemcentrx Assets
summary: Company books charge in connection with a 2016 acquisition, will review an additional $1 billion in assets. AbbVie Inc. will book a roughly $4 billion charge in connection with a 2016 acquisition that it billed as offering a promising cancer treatment.

title: PG&E to Shake Up Board
summary: Utility faces billions in potential liability costs related to its role in sparking wildfires in recent years. PG&E Corp. said Friday it plans to shake up its board as the company responds to concerns that it could face billions of dollars in liabilities related to the recent deadly wildfires in California.

title: Jobs for the Forgotten Man
summary: Wage increases are reaching even unskilled corners of the labor force.. Americans needed some reassuring economic news, and on Friday they received a double dose: First, a blowout jobs report for December, followed by a tacit admission by Chairman Jerome Powell that he had messed up at his December press conference by suggesting the Federal Reserve is on "auto-pilot" on its tightening course.

title: Your Government at Work
summary: Overwhelming demand for H-2B visas crashed a federal web portal.. Another great moment in government technology: On New Year's Day, the Department of Labor's online portal crashed as U.S. employers submitted tens of thousands of requests to bring in temporary foreign workers. Most will be disappointed because America still doesn't allow enough guest workers to meet demand.

title: American Charged in Russia Tried to Steal $10,000 as a Marine in Iraq
summary: More details emerged on Friday about Paul Whelan, who Moscow charged with espionage, including his multiple citizenships. MOSCOW-A former U.S. Marine arrested on espionage charges in Russia was removed from the military for trying to steal more than $10,000 in government cash while deployed at a base in Iraq, according to details of Defense Department court records released Friday.

title: A Soda Tax and Consequences
summary: As shoppers flee Philly, a supermarket closes and jobs disappear.. When Philadelphia became the first major U.S. city to pass a soda tax in 2016, Mayor Jim Kenney said it would improve public health while funding universal pre-K. Two years in, the policy hasn't delivered on that elite ideological goal. But the tax has come at the expense of working people and other vulnerable Philadelphians.

title: Lessons From a Republican Survivor
summary: Rep. Will Hurd, the congressman in Texas' toughest district, explains how he beats the odds-and why the GOP needs to reach out beyond its base.. San Antonio

title: Turkey Seeks Major U.S. Military Support to Adopt Fight in Syria
summary: Plan for Turkey to take lead in fight against Islamic State could require more U.S. force, not less, officials say. WASHINGTON-Turkey is asking the U.S. to provide substantial military support, including airstrikes, transport and logistics, to allow Turkish forces to assume the main responsibility for fighting Islamic State militants in Syria, senior U.S. officials say.

title: L.A.'s Teachers Union Can't Do Simple Math
summary: The school district is hemorrhaging cash and students, but the union plans to strike anyway.. Los Angeles

title: Fed Chairman Powell Sees Flexibility on Rates This Year
summary: Stocks rally after chairman says central bank isn't on a fixed path to push benchmark rate higher. ATLANTA-Federal Reserve officials on Friday laid the groundwork to take a break from raising short-term interest rates in coming months, propelling stock prices already cheered by a stronger-than-expected December jobs report.

title: FBI Investigating Fake Texts Sent to GOP House Members
summary: Person impersonating aide to Vice President Mike Pence sought whereabouts of certain lawmakers. WASHINGTON-The Federal Bureau of Investigation is investigating fake text messages sent to some House Republican lawmakers from someone impersonating a top aide to Vice President Mike Pence, according to people familiar with the matter.
